text: Good aromas and flavors of hay and grass malt, some bittering hops and a little alcohol. Pretty golden color with a small white head. Fuller bodied than a standard pils.

Golden color with a smaller, but stable white head. Attractive flow of bubbles. Sweet scents with caramel and hops. Hop scents of herbs and grass. Sweet start with some citrus and circus peanuts. Thicker feel, but enough effervescence so its not mouthcoating or chunky. More herbal in the finish and slightly peppery in the linger. Ive often stated that an imperial lager/pils is a malt liquor. I still think that, but this is a decent noble hopped malt liquor.

On tap at OConnors. Golden with white head. Aroma is malty, lagunitas house yeast, slight alcohol and some peachy fruit notes. Taste is malty and big, medium sweet, yeast, slight fruit with a warming finish

This is from an old bottle that was kept chilled. Very hoppy, fruity aroma. Flavors like nose with good bitterness, ditto carbonation and fairly well balanced. Great body. Excellent finish. Super easy drinking.
Draft: Poured a golden with white color head. Aroma was nice soft grain with hops. Taste was bitter hops that balanced well with the grain finish.

The ol Lagunitas trick of HOP EVERYTHING TO HELL continues to work great. For me, anyway. Imperial Pils has hazy gold looks and and a white, pillowy head thats totally appropriate for Pils. It smells dank, bready, boozy, and spicy. The flavors are herbal, grassy, and grainy. Dry, bitter, crisp, and sticky textures. No surprises here - just plenty of good drinking.
Pours golden with minimal lacing and carbonation. Malty sweetness with a Lagunitas expected hop finish to realize you are drinking beer. Certainly qualifies as a summer go to beer.

Pours a clear straw yellow with a medium head of white foam. Not much of an aroma. Crisp but has an odd taste. Hard to describe. Different than a normal Pilsner. Syrupy with a candy corn flavor. Not that enjoyable.
Bottle shared. Honey and orange nose with marmalade-like jammy quality. Big and bready malts, sweet on the palate. Bitter finish, but the sweetness is still there.
Golden, thin head. Big chewy lagunitas nose with some honeyish hops. Very chewy, sweet malts, nice honeyish hops.

Visual: Pours pale orange with lots of suspended sediment, a very small long-lasting 3mm micro creamy head, loose clusters of steady medium-sized bubble streams.

Nose: very faint hints of tangerine-kumquat hop oils, barley malt. (lvl-3)-pungency

Attack: cream-thicker-crisp

Mid-palate: zingy alcoholic heaviness, more thick creamy, (lvl-6-sweetness), tangy-light tangerine-kumquat citrusy hops, sweet barley malt

Finish: light tongue numbness, apple exhale, lingering bitter hops.

Summary: Solid flavours, body and mouthfeel. Not much on the nose but otherwise very enjoyable.

Bomber into snifter glass, clear lightly amber-hued golden color with bright white head. Aroma notes of grassy/earthy hops, malt sweetness, cereal, hay and some citrus. Taste adds more grassy/herbal hop bitterness, doughy bread, faint caramel an almost resin/wood note. Medium-heavy body, moderate carbonation, lively, tad creamy with lingering grass/citrus bitterness. Very well done, an amped up pils with some punch.
Dry grassy and earthy hops. Corn malts. Simple beer that is well executed. Tough style to nail, but this is a pretty good attempt.

On tap at Antenna America, it pours a golden copper with a thick foamy head. The aroma is full on malty peppery citrus hops. It pours a golden orange with a bone dry finish. The flavor is solid bready fruitiness. Nice but finishing a whole bomber by myself after a night on the town was not such a great idea.

8700th rating. Draft at the brewery, served in a classic Lagunitas dog mason jar glass. Pours a clear vivid gold with a finger of white head that settles into a lasting film. Notes of grass, cereal and pale and pils malts, hay, faint phenolics, and booze. Medium-bodied, with a sweet, boozy, bitter mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Not normally a style I enjoy, but this one was fine. Lagunitas is trusty like that.

On tap @ Lagunitas. Clear yellow/golden beer with white foam. Is a bit too sweet and obviously high boost for my tastes. At least some good grassy hops, bready malt, and citrus. Has a strangely resinous and piney hop character...well not strange for Lagunitas, but any variety of "pils". Kind of sticky and syrupy if you dont drink it cold. Wasnt a huge fan.

Bottle, shared with Parksy and Rockley. Medium gold, lasting white head. Bready, pale malts, heavy cereal character, medium sweetness. Grassy hop character fits nicely, bitter finish offers balance. Not my favourite style, but this was quite good.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle in hotel room Orlando 2016... Dark amber.. Massive foam off white head.. Soft sweet toffee malts.. Light citrus nose... Soft sweet caramel fruit.. Light biscuit.. Light citrus

Gold pour with a big fluffy head. Some odd notes in the aroma - a little burnt rubber in the malty sweetness. Ramping up a pilsener is a risky move, and this is not a total success. Fairly sugary, with what seems like a standard hop profile for the style. This doesnt do it for me, but Im not a huge fan of pilseners in general.

1/29/16. On tap at Craft Bar Grand Blvd. Golden pour with a nice off-white head, good lacing. Plain aroma, grainy, citrus and grass. Nice flavor, smooth pale maltiness, bready, doughy, citrus and grass. Tasty!
Draft - Sweet lemony citrus. Clear gold with a decent white head. Lemon, booze and a light bitterness.

Draft at the brewery. Pours clear, bright gold with a frothy white head. Rich white bread in the nose, a little honey, cereal. Pretty sweet, with definite alcohol boost, sugary white bread, light hay. Full bodied with average carbonation. Warming finish, more sugary white bread, some raw alcohol, pale grains. Pretty strong. A white collar malt liquor. So so.

Draft at the brewery taproom. RBWG 2016. Bright golden orange coloured pour with a sticky white head. Aroma is sweet Apple toffee, clean sweet grains. Flavour is semi sweet grains, clean ferment, little sweet toffee, apple. Palate is medium full, sticky, highish carbonation. Good.

Draft at source. A strong citrus aroma of orange and kumquat. Light peppery notes. Some sulfur. Very clear pale Yellow with small head. Tate is mostly neutral malts and a hint of citrus hops. Light white bread notes with honey. A touch of alcohol in the finish. Decent.

Draught at Lagunitas, Petaluma. Clear deep golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, light grain, bread, biscuit and pine. Taste is very light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of citrus, tangerine, bread and grain. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice.

Sample on tap at the brewpub. Clear gold pour with thin white head. Aroma is malty, nice pils malt, light grass, light fruity boozy notes. Taste is grainy, nice fresh pils malt, reminiscent of some czech specialnis. Palate is med-light bodied with good carbonation. Tasty stuff.
This is a magic Pils. So very good. Great look. Great taste. There might be be better, and I hope I taste it, but what more could you want. Fulfilment! 8.6 ABV. amazing..

Pours a crystal clear golden color with two fingers of white foam that laces nicely. Nose is a mix of cornflakes, honey, grass and bread. Palate is a bit more sticky than Id expect in a pils but considering its abv I guess this is what you get. Not quite into this beer... its like taking the best aspects of a pilsner and ignoring them. Sweet honey, bitter grass, sticky palate, meh ill let my wife finish this one.

Bomber as Lagunitas Imperial Pils, Alc. 8.6% by Vol. Clear golden yellow, firm white rocky foam settles and lasts. Grassy grainy pils malt aroma. Taste is initially quite strong, medium sweet grainy cereal malt, lightly bitter grassy floral hop, some citrus. Average carbonation, medium bodied, moderately hopped. LBW (Lagerboys Be Wary)
Bomber - Golden yellow with a thin head. Has a spicy pepper taste, fairly hoppy and crisp. The mouthfeel is sharp and and carbonated.

Appearance: Pours a crystal clear, yellow-hued body with a medium-small, white, foaming head.

Smell: Pilsner malts with a little oxidation showing and hoppy hints of citrus (leaning a little orange) and some herbal-toned hops.

Taste: Pils malt, still a bit sweet and still hinting at some oxidative sherry-like tastes. Citrusy, orangey hops, even, with a bit of spicy dried herbs and some bitterness to temper the sweetness upfront. Drying in the finish, though some sweetness does remain, and, when hitting those hops, touches on some orange marmalade.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-plus carbonation.

Overall: I will always say taking a refreshing style and doubling/imperializing it does not make it twice as refreshing, but, still, it thankfully didnt veer into an area that was too sweet, too hot or too gloopy in body. Still, Id so much rather drink their basic PILS than then this.

Pale straw yellow with a thin head, not much carbonation. Some grassy wheat aroma, not too much going on in the nose. Flavor is clean with a bit of bready sweetness and noble hops. A touch of ethanol and funky butter round out the palate. Light, crisp mouthfeel. Pretty good.

Draft at Brixx Asheville. Pours golden with a thin white head. Has some lacing in the glass. Slight grassy note on the nose. Kind of boozy on the tongue along with some grassy notes. Finish lingers. Not really feeling this one. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear golden. Nose of herbally pine, citrus, and sweet golden malt. Tangy citrus and pine with more sweet pilsner malt. Light diacetyl. Lingering tacky bitterness.

22oz sharp shoulder type bomber pours with a crystal clear pure gold body that supports a fluffy cobweby dirty white head of foam. The aroma offers up cracker malts, estery pear and apple fruitiness, a dash of fussel like notes and then a big dose of floral and spicy hops. The taste begins rich with sweet near sugary malts, a blast of bitter yet somewhat malt sweetened floral hops and then pear to apple to honey sweet booze. Somehow I thought this would be more juicy hop extract forward but its not. It drinks ok though for a style a usually stay away from due to the over sweetness.

22 oz bomber pours a golden color with a nice white head. Aromas of cereal, citrus and pine. Medium bodied, nice beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pour was golden with nice white head. Aroma of cereal and grass. Flavor followed with some floral notes at the fore. Balanced. Finishes with body and some good carbonation.

From bomber on the Lagunitas label. Pours clear yellow with a one-finger white sudsy head that sticks around as a thin layer on the surface. Aroma of pine and some fruit. Taste is sweet and light fruits, some pine with grassy overtones. Moderately hoppy bitterness. A bit boozy - more than the 8.6% ABV would indicate.

Bomber. Imperial pils. (Not scare city label). 
Sweet pale malt aroma. 
Hay malt. Sweetness covers up most of what I dont like about a Pilsner. 
Very subtitle flavors. Extremely drinkable with a meal.

Tap bocktown. Hope this is the right spot, so many lag imp pils. Sweet pine aroma. Taste is quite an evolution; starts off fruity then goes to a hop punch in the face. Hoppy piercing bite sets in. More that the ol lager lovin taste buds can appreciate. Toowards the nd , there are volatile vapors mixed in the  aroma.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Light yellow. Thin head. Aroma is like hop stupid, real nice for imperial pils. Sweet juicy fruits. Same in taste with light malts, smooth, slick. Really good for a style that can suck pretty bad. Greatly drinkable.

Draft. Pours a medium thick, well retained, white head, with Belgian curtain lacing. over a clear gold (SRM 5) body.....mose is moderate Pils malts, with cereal malts, sweet honey notes, mild herbal hops.......taste is mild floral honey sweet, with moderate cereal malts, mild hop spice, finishing with light hop bitterness.......mouth feel, medium body, light alcohol warmth, high carbonation. This is too sweet for the Pilsner family. Better attenuation would correct, perhaps requiring a yeast change or a raise in fermentation temperature. The hop bitterness is quite low for a Lagunitas confection. This is a nice variation on on the Pils type, falling somewhere in the general vicinity of a Golden Strong and a big Malt Liquor. BJCP 7/3/12/4/6

Bottle. Pours gold with a massive sticky white head. Loads of fresh floral hop aroma. Flavors of sweet malt, stone fruits, floral hops, and bread. Resiny hop finish. Somewhat sticky mouthfeel that subtly coats the mouth. A bit of alcohol warmth. Very nice. Rich, malty and hoppy. Much like an IPA, but with hallertau hops.
Aromas of orange candy, grass, slight booze. Clear burnished gold with a mostly lasting white head. Pretty dry, some caramel flavors, strong. Medium bodied, savory.

Appearance: clear pale gold with one fat finger of pillowy head, excellent retention and lacing. (5/5) Aroma: pale malt, grassy, stone fruit, floral. (7/10) Taste: moderate-high sweet, mild bitter. (7/10) Palate: light somewhat slick body, moderate carbonation, medium duration warming finish. (4/5)

Beefy beast of a pilsener. Starts off hoppy but that fades and it becomes a slick, hot malt bomb. On the up side, that means it can keep up with my Ratlami Sev snackies. (15/20)

Pours clear gold over a frothy white head yielding to some coarseness as it dissipated. Very bubbly. Grassy, esters, piney hops on the nose. Interesting taste, much maltier than I expected, some sweet fruitiness, plum, apple, even a little raisin...rounded out with hops. Good.
Yellowish with a white foamy head. Crisp and punchy with cereal and citrus, leading to a hoppy finish that is not too bitter or dry. Well balanced, but full and strong.
Sample at Strong Ale Fest 2015. Comes a clear bright gold with a nice white head. Aroma of malt, grass, and grain. Taste is malt, grass, grain, and floral. Well made.

Pours clear yellow into a shaker. Bright white head with little retention recedes to skin surface. Malt and corn aromas. Hot with sweet caramel and corn syrup upfront turning slightly cloying on the medium length finish. Tastes like an Eastern European alco bomb.
Hazy straw/gold color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of malt, floral hops, grain, & some citrus; Flavor of sweet malt, caramel, hops/grain, some fruit, and citrus; Dry finish; Pretty decent.

Keg at Sedona Charlottesville. Clear golden, large creamy white head, good retention. Aroma of floral, grassy hops and pale malt. The taste is floral and citrus hops, pale bready malt. Medium bodied, mild lingering bitterness, well balanced.

Draft at Moriartys. Clear gold pour with a frothy white head that reduces to a lasting ring and splashes of lace. Fuller and juicer than most Pils. Amber fruit. Oak resins. Hints of Sherry. Not much aroma. Clean taste and easy finish - though an alcohol burn arrives afterwards and lingers.

22FL OZ ($ FREE) got this free from a local Bevmo. This was a pretty good beer. I like a pilsner every now and then and this was very good. you dont notice the strength at all until its too late. taste is that of a high quality pils. this is like a perfect pilsner with the punch of a tuff IPA.

Sample from a bottle. Clear golden color. Thin white head, some bits of lace. Medium to bigger body. Kind of crisp, lighter carbonation. Light slick. Good bigger breadiness. Some mild pepper, bit of dough. Pretty satisfying, bigger but still in balance. Moderate sweet taste, moderate bitter, pleasant mild warmth. A solid example of the style. Nice to enjoy with a sandwich.

Bottle from 7-11: Created a thick large pillow of foam while a golden liquid rested below. Aroma is mild but has a fragrant whiff of hops while a notice of grains and oat like malt lurk in the background. The body of the beer is heavy and taste of alcohol while also delivering a green hop pellet flavoring. Towards the finish, harsh flavors come out and remind me of swallowing cough syrup or some other kind of astringent medicine that isnt that pleasant while drinking a whole bomber of a beer. The high ABV is doing what it is supposed to on my CNS and because it was only $5 and change for a bomber well worth it the flaws. Score of 4 is as high as I can go.

22 oz. bottle. Pours hazed deep golden with a medium white head. Aroma of herbal and grassy hops, some booze and some bready malts. Flavor is bready with strong booze and hop bitterness. Medium body with lively carbonation, notwithstanding the bitterness. Lingering bitter finish.

Jaune claire (mais pas aussi claire quun pilsner normal) avec une petite robe blanche. Larôme des céréales, un peu du pain, et dhoublon florale.En bouche cest un peu sucré, épais pour le style (bien sur pour une bière impériale!), et pas mal amer (mais encore, pour le style). Bonne, plein du corps, et très unique. Bravo!

Straw color, limpid, occasional tiny bubble, tight lace. 
Medium body, silky texture, full flavored, nice heat but low carbonation, long and flavorful finish. 
Bittersweet, balancing acidity. 
Hoppy, herbal, malty. 
Delicious, complete pils, more Bohemian than German in style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, labeled the Imperial Pils. Couldve sworn Ive had this before. Just what Phoenix beer geeks need -- a refreshing beer that still packs a punch. Occasionally I find myself in the mood for a really good pilsner, and a little extra oomph is a bonus. This is a good, snappy Czech pils on its own merits. (#6052, 10/24/2015)

Bomber bottle. Aroma is hops. Appearance is a very carbonated gold with a frothy, white head. Taste is alcohol that is coverEd by the hops. Some paler malts are also in there. Palate is hop bitter with a heavier than normal for a pils mouthfeel. Overall, about what I would expect of a dry hopped imperial pils. I figured with it being a lagunitas, it would be way more hoppy and dank. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle as Lagunitas Imperial Pils. I swear Ive had this before. Dry hopping gives a good aroma, sense of the lager in the taste but not overwhelming.

(En fût au Slater 50/50 Liberty Station): Des effluves granuleuse et sucrées portent en elles une présence houblonnée florale. Même chose en bouche sur un corps sirupeux et collant. Bon mais je suis sceptique tant quà la pertinence de ce genre de bière.

Pour is a clear yellow with a large white head. Aroma is a nice dry blonde malt with a decent spicy hop addition, Flavor is also a very clean and dry malt with a nice grassy and spicy hop. Finish is a heavy but dry lager type malt and a decent hop showingtoo finish things off. This is a better showing of the Impy pils style. No malt liquor harsh finish with this beer. Lots of malt and hop shine here.

resin, grass, on the tongue, punchy on the nose, I really appreciate this offering from Lagunitas. many of their ales have a similar yeast profile, but this one hides that with its roasty maltiness slicked up in a creamy pils, alcohol starts to kick in midway thru your 2nd pint.

Bottle - big foamy head, clear medium gold color, medium grassy and earthy hop aroma and flavor, medium light malt backbone, slightly sweet finish, good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear golden pour with small off white head. Aroma of hops, pine, yeast and faint caramel. Taste of malts, hops, caramel, biscuits and faint citrus. Full bodied, medium carbonation, creamy thick mouthfeel and a hoppy finish.
Bottle. It poured a light golden color with a white head. The aroma was of pine, grass and some spices. The taste was of grass, pine and malts. Good stuff.

Crisp copper coloured body with a nice, two centimetre tall tan head. Aroma of alcohol, metal, hops, earth and way more alcohol - very boozy. Medium-bodied; Very strong metallic and earthy flavour, but the alcohol and burn is incredible - not very easy to drink. Aftertaste shows some hops and earth with a touch of caramel sweetness, but the alcohol, booze and metal are way too strong - this tastes like one of those cheap Eastern European lagers that you get in cans that are around 9,0% abv, and that isnt a compliment. Overall, not worth drinking nor buying, unless you want a high alcohol lager, this one just isnt good. I was expecting more due to the ratings, but im glad im done with this one. I sampled this 65 cL bottle purchased from Costco in Pentagon City (Arlington), Virginia on 30-August-2015 for US$4,99 sampled at home in Upstate New York (New Paltz) on 09-October-2015.

22 oz bottle pours a clear golden color. Small but lasting tight white head leaves some lacing. Aroma is full of grains, hay, biscuits, and honey with some floral hops. Flavor is full of malty sweetness with some bitterness in the finish. Body is medium with a smooth, slightly sticky mouthfeel. This one packs quite a punch, and is a pleasure to find at Lagunitas reasonable price.
Pale gold color pour with smallish head and decent lacing. Grainy aroma. Grains and hay flavor with a mild citrus zing. Slightly boozy and grassy. I enjoyed it.

Clear pale golden with a thin sticky white head. Biscuity malty nose with a little noble hop earthy bitterness. Nothing surprising there--smells like it should. Big full flavor with some yeasty boozy Czech malt and Pilsen flavor with a mild and subdued earthy hop bitterness. Just a big, clean, slightly boozy and tasty pils.

Pours a deep gold with foamy white head. Smells grassy and floral yet packs a sweet malty punch once tasted. Extremely well balanced with the sweetness offset by a slightly bitter finish. High alcohol content well incorporated. Very pleasant slightly sticky palate. Excellent beer!

rootrootdrink .. . smells like a lagunitas beer .. . gold yellow, clear .. solid white head and lacing .. . mosiac like sweetness, grass, dried grass, and hay booze .. mouth is a bit sticky .. not bad, but still a high end malt liquor .. . . those old people are making out on that bench over there! gross!!

22 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 9/4/2015. Pours crystal clear bright golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass with a light amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big lemon, tangerine, peach, pineapple, mango, melon, pepper, pine, cracker, bread, light honey, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of citrus/tropical/earthy hops and moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big lemon, tangerine, peach, pineapple, mango, melon, pepper, pine, cracker, bread, light honey, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Moderate amount of piney/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, tangerine, peach, pineapple, mango, melon, pepper, pine, cracker, bread, and herbal/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical/earthy hops and moderate pale malt flavors; with a good malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Good amount of dryness after the finish from bitterness. Very clean on lager flavors with zero yeast ester notes present. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth and moderately crisp/sticky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent imperial pilsener style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical/earthy hops and moderate pale malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering.

750ml bottle shared by Dan. Poured a clear golden yellow with a small foamy white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, peach, floral hops, and grain. Taste of grapefruit, pine, grass, lemon zest, dry grain, and some booziness.

22oz bottle 10/6/15 (Jewel)-40° in Mug-Pours a clear golden with a big white head. Aroma of citrus, sweetness, grassy, malty, and hoppy. Taste of the same with nore sweetness. This light to medium bodied brew is well balanced and quite tasty.

Squealer from Lisais Chester Market. Clear gold with dense head and lace. Lemony grassy hop aroma with a little honey cracker and a whiff of booze. Mild honey cracker sweetness with some graininess and assertive bitterness, a little too herbal for my tastes, that lingers and a hint of booze. Medium light body slick but not sticky. Pretty good, but imperial pilsners is a tough taste for me, ditto for helles bock. Anyhow, good.

On tap. Pours a clear gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a good amount of straw and sweet grain with a bit of light fruit underlying. Flavor has lots of straw with a growing sweet grain note and a bit of grass supporting.

This was poured into a pilsener glass.
The appearance was a burnt yellow color. Light carbonation could be seen rising to fill a rapidly dissipating one fingered head. Lacing was messy with a semi-thick appeal to it.
The smell starts off with a sweet grassiness rolling into some light delicate malt (slightly like corn).
The taste was moderately sweet and taking the sweet grassiness to blend in a slight grainy sort of fashion. Theres a semi-smooth sweet grassy edge to the aftertaste and riding into the aftertaste.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium in body with a nice sessionability about it. Carbonation feels good for the style and for me. Its sticky, but not cloying.
Overall, this is a pretty nice Double/Imperial Pilsener. Id have it again.

From 22oz bottle to lager glass. Pour is a transparent yellow, thick white frothy head with very lively carbonation. Nose is hoppy, piney, floral. Taste is light-medium bodied, back and forth between bitterness and sweetness. Very carbonated beer yet complimenting. Finishes crisp.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2015 Floral. Lemon biscotti. Light yet so smooth and velvety. Its sublime and a must try. German or Check, its one of the best Pilsners beers Ive ever tasted. I thought Lagunitas has been a bit overrated lately but this time they knocked it of the park.

Oh hell yeah. HUGE juicy crystal and cascade hop nose. Flavor has the crisp malt bill of a pils but thicker and of course much much hoppier. A little sweetness from the hops as well. Doesnt much resemble a classic pils anymore, but in this case, thats not a bad thing.
Love the big bold malty flavor of this imperial... Smooth, lightly fruity esthers and sweet finish bit balanced... Crisp for an imperial.
Autumn Brew Review 2015. Gold color, thin head. Grassy hops, dry flavor, earth.Flavors are good, it has a pilsner bite that I like, even though a pilsner should never be brewed in an imperial style.
(Bottle) I actually really like this! Its nice and refreshing, and has a bit of a farmhouse-style flavor to it. One of the best pilsners Ive had yet. Recommended.
Bomber to Pilsner glass. Classic, thick, persistent head. Pale straw color. Mild and smooth for a high ABV. Good value, decent beer.

Pour out of 22 oz bottle, clear orange pour with white head, aroma brought notes of orange peel, caramel, biscuit, orange marmalade, toast, hints of grass, slight earthy notes. Taste was sweet orange, orange marmalade, hints of grass, slight vanilla, touch of yeast, slight biscuit, finishing fairly bitter, slightly sweet.

sizable and lively head, with a lot of carbonation. Inviting appearance. 

The smell is relatively subtle, with the exception of a distinct hoppy nose.

Quite a hoppy lager, but definitely an enjoyable one, even for a non-hop head like me. Great, yet subdued, chocolate aftertaste which lingers in your mouth for quite some time. The taste is definitely not characteristic of a lager, yet it is incredibly smooth. The light carbonation is surprising consider the appearance, which was a delightful surprise.

This was a thoroughly enjoyable beer, that I am definitely going to get again.

Bottle picked up at the COOP... Poured into my CBC Teku... Clear dark golden with a sudsy white head.. Weird pink bubblegummy type aroma that combines with some heavy EtOH... Flavor has plenty of maltiness but not enough hop bitterness to balance... Odd sorta melon quality... This one is all over the place, I would have guessed Lagunitas was shooting for some sorta of Malt Liquor.. sweet and a bit cloying... Not very good IMO.

Bottle from Legacy, Vancouver, as Lagunitas Imperial Pilsner, 8.6% ABVBlond color, clean, with medium sized head. Delicate malt aroma with a flowery touch. Lean mouthfeel; wisely they chose to go for a moderate amount of sweetness; there is an evident but not disturbing alcohol presence, and the mouthfeel is not oily; it has some grassy hops; some crackery malt is a nice touch, but a bit more was expected from the hops.Nice, not so special.

22 oz. bottle, pours a hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is fairly grassy, with piney and grassy dry hopping upfront and a very nice herbaceous quality. Flavour is quite fresh and juicy, with dry hopping and juicy grassiness upfront, with a dry biscuity malt backbone. Juicy, fresh and grassy, though finishes with a bit too much sweetnes on the finish. A slight ABV burn too that complements things nicely. Nice, but could use less sweetness.
Great big flavors of hops a little citrus. A Lagunitas beer through and through. Typical of thier styles of beer

Bomber bottle to shaker glass, pours clear light golden. Two finger white head, nice lacing and retention. Aroma of barnyard, bread and flowers. Taste is nicely balanced, big grassy/floral hop bitterness, bready, grassy sweetness. Medium bodied, lively carbonation, sticky mouth feel. Finishes bitter and long. Best Imperial Pilsner Ive tasted to date.

This is an imperial Pilsner! Great Color, Body, Aroma, and Head Retention. Floral, Dry and Grassy with hints of toasted nut and biscuit flavors. Hints of a Hop BOMB on the nose, which is standard for beers from Lagunitas but not the palate. Great Stuff and worth picking up.

This beer pours a little darker and less clear than a typical pilsner. The aroma is absolutely exploding with hops with a forest-like character, but also a noticeable malt presence. This beer was well made and succeeds in balancing malt and hops; but I think it is a bit much. I missed the dryness and simple malt profile of a typical pilsner.

Poured from bottle into a snifter
 Appearance  The beer pours a clear golden amber color with a big three finger white foam head. The head has a fantastic level of retention, slowly fading over time to leave tons of foamy lace on the sides of the glass.
 Smell  The aroma of the beer is quite strong of a sweeter tangerine and orange aroma with a decent showing of some other more bready and doughty smells. Other fruit aromas of a tropical nature as well as a little bit of an earthy and grassy hop nature are there as well, giving it a rather sweet and inviting smell overall. 
 Taste  The taste begins much drier then what I was anticipating form the nose. It begins with a rather strong cracker malt taste mixed with a bit of fruity sweetness of an apple and tangerine nature. Upfront the hop is light, but some flavors of an herbal and grassy nature develop as the taste moves forward. All the while, the sweeter flavors upfront lose a bit of intensity all while more hop and a bit of a alcohol booziness comes to the tongue. With these transitions also comes some lighter notes of a melon flavor and a bit of a floral flavor right at the end, leaving one with a somewhat warming and surprisingly fruity and somewhat dank hopped cracker malt taste to linger on the tongue.
 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the averages side in terms of its thickness with a carbonation level that is on the average side as well. While a little thicker body may have been better for the lighter hop tastes (accentuating them a bit), the feel was pretty good overall, as it did nicely for the slightly sweet and more cracker like tastes of the brew.
 Overall- I have to say I rather enjoyed this beer. Lagunitas never really lets me down. This is another great brew with tons of flavor at a great price for a bomber.
22 ounce bottle. Crisp and hoppy. Clear yellow in color. Bitter with fading sweet. Nice.
Sweet aroma, with a hint of hops. Not much carbonation for a pils. Pilsener taste with some extra sweetness from the additional malt. Sweet finish with just a hint of bitterness.

Bomber 22 oz. Golden pour with nice white persistent head. Tastes like a big, fat, broad pilsner in the mouth, but hides its 8.6% ABV fantastically. Overall, if you like Imperial versions of beer styles, this one is a keeper.
Bottle. Gold with a big white head. Sweet malt, grapefruit, straw and honey. Medium creamy mouthfeel and moderate carb. Very nice.

Nicely done. Dry hopping is effective and gives a dry, bitter finish to balance the grainy, malt base.Pousr a bright golden orange with a fizzy white head, light lacing. The nose has mild resin and citrus notes, grainy, spice notes and a bit of florality. Easy going and well balanced but medium to full bodied and warm, big on the finish. Good example of this style.

Pours crystal clear golden yellow with a white head. Aroma has big pils malt, a bit of sweetness, grassy / floral hops, cobwebs and a bit of pine. It has a slick full body with fairly light carbonation. Starts with sweet malt, spicy / grassy / piny hops, candy and some alcohol. The finish is a bit warmer and quite hoppy. Decent.

650ml bottle pours a clear golden color with a finger of white head that settles to reveal some spotted lacing on the glass. Aroma is light fruits and grains with some spicy notes. Taste is a light fruity and malty sweetness with a spicy and grassy hop bitterness. Light to medium body with good carbonation. A bit more hop presence than a traditional pilsner, but also sweetness as well. Overall, this is still a nice strong pilsner that is easy to drink.
Bomber pours a clear golden with a large white head. Citrus hop aroma with caramel malt. Taste of citrus and semi grassy hops, dry caramel malt and some yeast on the finish. Ok, not a great Pilsner.

22 oz bottle. Clear golden, with a thick lasting white head, and sticky lace. Aroma is grassy, citrusy, light bready malt. Flavor is on the sweet side to start, doughy malt, followed by some piney and citrusy hops. A little too sweet, for a Pils, but I still like it.

Clear straw colored with a white head. Big citrus and floral aroma. Taste is sweet fruit and grains, booze, and a nice solid bitterness. Medium-full bodied with just the right carbonation, sticky, and a little dry. Pretty nice.

Dear god this is a delicious beer. Big juicy and hoppy. Smells like a big dank ipa with a sharp pilsner aroma cutting through it. Taste is juicy citrus and tropical. Lots of balance from the pilsner malt. Reminds me a lot of a Jacks Abbey ipl which they absolutely crush. This is probably in the top three best Lagunitas beers Ive had. Absolutely worth the money, they nailed this one. Cheers!!

Lets face it, imperial Pilsener is a shit style. This one is clear and yellow orange with a small foamy head. It is over sweet and sticky with a woody pine hop character. Its heavy and thick and hard to drink. No sir, I do not like it.
Aroma is tropical fruit, hops and slightly perfumed/floral. The flavor is medium tropical fruit, fruit, malts and a lightly bitter/slight heat in the finish.
Moderate sweet malt beginning aroma with citrus resin hops following. Clear light golden cult with a large white head. Sweet creamy beginning with a light bitter finish.
This beer was a nice treat from the Pilsners but it seemed like the imperial was missing something.

From a bomber bottle.

A very fruity pils, way more so than any European version I know of.

Excellent clarity with a decent head.

O: a refreshing favorite at a bottle share event with unlimited samples of 16 beers.

22 ounce bottle. Bright yellow gold color. Large rocky white head. wonderful fragrant pine hop nose. Crisp sweet malt flavor has tropical fruit notes. Spicy hops in midtaste. Some caramel notes. That evident Lagunitas dry hop character is ever present. This is one tasty pils.

Bomber from Corti Bros. Pours gold with a creamy, foamy white head. Aroma is fruit and grass. Med body or better. Flavor is pale malt with a lot of grass, and at least a little spice. Heat doesnt seem to be an issue, but it does warm the tum. Finishes grassy bitter. Very nice Impy Pils.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2015 Im really not sure what more could have been done to the pils style of beer that would make it more enjoyable than what has been done here. I get the bite that all pils should have (kinda peppery), Its got the clear golden pils look, got the little bit of dry. But then they fattened it up with some hops and a nice strong alcohol content (8.6%). I think these things make pils a viable beer style and undo some of the damage big American beer companies have done to it over the last hundred years. The pils style has been improved right before our eyes and they put their signature on it.

650ml bottle. Stupid concept. Tastes nothing liek a pils. But I will say it woudl have worked if they jsut called this lagunitas strong lager, it has not much character but goes down smooth for the abv.

P: Golden straw with a two finger head. S: Spicy hops, cilantro, herbs, biscuits, and yeast. T: Spicy hops at first, followed by limes and minerals. With a yeasty finish. Noticeable alcohol but the hops help keep that in check. M: Light and highly carbonated. O:
Clear yellow nice head. Nose is grassy, a bit herbal hoppy. Taste is kinda like an Double IPA but not as hoppy. Lots of body for a pils, not exactly crisp or refreshing. Eh.

Bottle. Crystal clear yellow gold. Citrus hop aroma. The taste adds grains, crust, and bready malts. The signature lagunitas dry hop element is very noticeable on the finish. Great stuff all around. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber (8.6%) from Fred Meyer. Crystal clear medium golden in color. Highly hopped nose. Quite pungent with a little bit of sweetness. Some nice grainiess with a bit of a malt backbone. Strong grainy flavors. A lot of hoppiness with some sweetness and alcohol. Quite big. Definitely tastes like a imperial pils.
Pours a clear golden color. This white head with lots of sticky lacing. Grainy straw aroma. Fruity, grainy and a bit sweet.

Amazingly priced bomber from Xroads. Poured a pretty clear golden yellow body with an average to smaller foamy white head. Aroma is dry malts, lots of grains, crusts, straw and toast. Body is bigger, noticable heat, a dry finish that boarders on harsh and lighter big bubble carbonation. Flavor is mostly malty, dough, crusts, wet grains and a hint of raisin skins. This beer is bumped up on the overall for the amazing price but this is still an odd style IMO.

Tallahassee, Fl - ABC Fine Wine & Spirits - Betton - 22 oz bomber. Sparkling medium golden pour, bubbly snow white head. Sweet gumball-like aroma, a touch of white grapes. Solid flavor with some light citrus bitterness, some honey sweetness, a touch of white grape juice, Mouthfeel has a decent thickness to it. Nice,

22 oz bottle purchased from Fred Meyer in South Salem OR
$3.99
says 8.6% alc.
Pours a pale sunflower oil yellow with a large thick and creamy/bubbly white head.
Nice fruity ,malty aromas, great wafts of floral hop. Excellent.
Taste is similar to the aroma but quite dry..fruity hops balanced..nice.
Great mouth feel to it..smooth and stylish.
A very nice beer as expected from Lagunitas.

Pours clear pale yellow with a big foamy white head. Aroma is grassy,big fruity citrus, tropical fruit, floral, and earthy yeastiness. Flavor is sweet caramel, biscuity malt followed by big citrus and tropical fruits with mineral notes. Floral hops and earthy, herbal yeast finish. Very crisp and clean brew .
Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Sweet grass and hops with a thick mouthfeel. Good but ultimately too cloying / sweet in the end.
An accurately named beer, in that it has some of the dryness and malt of a pilsener but with a noticeably stronger alcohol content. Okay.

22 oz bottle from Sams for 4.59. Pours clear straw gold with a white head. Aroma is faint grass, malt and slightly hoppy. Not much going on. Taste is pretty standard pilsner style, slightly sweet, some malts, no real aftertaste to speak of. Dry in the mouth. Body is average, seems a bit too carbonated as well. Overall this is beer looks nice and is drinkable but is not my style really. Also, my bottle says 8.6% ABV, not 8.3%.

The aroma is Caramel, pilsner malt, grassy, sweet, honey. 
The appearance is yellow/amber, white head, clear. The flavor is malty, caramel, pilsner malt, grassy, honey, spicy. The finish is grassy, spicy hops. Medium in body, slightly thicker. Nice overall.

A medium, creamy tight, frothy crowned head creates a nearly solid wall of dimensional lace all around the glass over a crystal clear sunny golden body with a collection of large clinging bubbles

Familiar Lagunitas aromas and flavors of green shaded tropical citrus, melon influenced hop juice... this one is brightened further with a high fidelity floral character with accents of green pepper and mint embossed with pine... with warmth a general sense of creaminess has influence acting as the balancing agent... a subtle sense of mineral and slightly stanky grain reminds me this is a Pilsener... easy going and well nuanced on a flowing, lean yet creamy, lightly dry, somewhat gelatinous medium body... a light touch of alcohol as the nearly transparent finish leads to mellow, clean residuals of the previously mentioned components... clean with enjoyable hop character... well done

22oz bottle code 183 5 2 0519 1648 served at 45° into Bormioli Rocco Electra 15 oz Multi-Purpose glass

From Notes.
>>>>>>>>>>&g
Tap. Clear gold, big sticky white lacing. Resin, tropical fruit, some biscuit in the aroma as well. Flavor is less intense, biscuit dough, dry, and slightly earthy. Medium slick body.
draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo, NY. Straw colored pour, amped up pils, citrus hops, grass,straw notes. good flavor, nice mouthfeel. well done

Draft with Linh in SF. Pours a light golden body with white lacing. Aroma is pine, grass, spice and light skunk character. Mouthfeel is light and crisp with notes of spicy grass, pine and crackery malt. Nice.

Keg at Beermongers, PDX, thanks to Luke for the share 09/11/14.
Clear pale golden with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is bready malt, citric rinds, straw, light farmyard essence.
Taste comprises grapefruit, bitter orange, light spice, straw.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with hop pangs.
Decent clean drinking citric lead hoppy pils.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Aroma of yeast, grass and grain. Pale gold colour with a small white well laced head. Dry mouth with a taste of grain and clean nutty straw finish. A very drinkable beer.

Minimal notes, on tap at Trappeze, Athens, GA. Clear golden yellow pour, fluffy white head. Aroma is sweet grapefruit and citrus, straw and grass, pils malt, taste follows. Clean and easy, no hint that it is that high in alcohol.

On tap at Beermongers. 

A: Semi-clear gold, fluffy white head.

N: Huge pineapple and mango. Sweet oranges and a notable onion powder. Some marijuana, grass, and peppercorn.

T: Very grassy, mostly sweet, lightly bitter.

M: Medium body. No alcohol burn. Bubbly, creamy carbonation.

O: Big oniony Imperial Pilsner. The hopping here is very in your face, and its the usual yeast profile. Personally, I enjoyed it quite a bit.

on tap @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Clear pale amber, bubbly white head cover, band of lace. Taste is simple malt accompanied by light, but clear, hops. Mild growth in the palate, but mostly an easy drinking enjoyable brew.
Had on tap at Floyds Pub in neighborhood. Good crisp pils.............................
Draft at Julians. Clear bright yellow color. Aroma of dusty hay. Taste is oeppery freadh haystacks. Very nice.

Tap at Julians. Aroma is sweet corn and Pils malt, light alcohol, spicy hops and clean. Pours clear gold with a large, frothy white head, long retention with excellent lacing. Flavor is sweet and crisp malt, bright hops, medium bitterness and a clean lager character with a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draft. Large off-white head with nice lacing atop crystal clear apple juice body. Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit/straw, some lemon. Taste is moderately sweet, earthy/lemon/grapefruit. Soft medium-full body, some resin, alcohol well contained.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2014 Sample at GABF 10/03/2014, thanks to my sis for assistance with note-taking. Golden color with a medium white head that evaporates steadily. Strings of lacing. Aroma of grassy hops, malt and fruit. Medium body with flavors of spicy hops, toasted malt and fruit. The finish is mildly bitter with an herbal hops aftertaste. Decent overall.

Sandpaper colored and very clear. Has lagunitas distinctive house flavor but has great bitterness that finishes strong. Hoppy but not boozy or spicy. I am not in love with pilseners but I do love lags house flavor so its balanced out

At triangle wine, Morrisville..Ok aroma hoppy and doughy. Clean yellow gold color good head, ok lace. bitter sweet flavor. Light body oily creamy mouthfeel, bitter dry sweet finish. Its nice, flavor best part for me. Aroma was ok. Good overall fun to try, could be a nice summer beer, though its not summer. Anymore
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Tap at Barcade for Anniversary party, poured clearish golden orange with small white head. Notes of corn and pilsner malt along with apple sauce light aroma. Lightly ashy and pine hop but not hoppy enough imo. Just another bland, minimal flavor pilsner. Ill stick to the pales and IPAs
Tap at Jeffrey. Pours golden with white head. Nose is pilsner malt and tropical fruit. Tastes of mangos and guava, malt, some hop pinyness, peppery. Bitter finish and crisp palate. Delightful.
Sampled at GABF. Clear golden appearance with a white head. Grassy, floral notes, crisp hops, pilsner malts, light fruits, herbs and light peppery spice. Smooth and fresh.

On tap at the Beer Baron. It pours a clear light gold color with a creamy white head. The aroma has some really nice notes of gooseberry and citrus with light florals, white grape and crackery/bready malts. The flavor is strong citrus, grass, floral bitterness and little grape and honey. The alcohol is definitely felt and tasted. Oily body with more alcohol and bitterness in the finish. Very tasty.
Draft at dukes in crystal lake. Golden clear with very sticky white head. Hops and fruits on the nose. Like a pale ale in my opinion. Good mild hop and bitter fruity tropical flavor. Well done.
Pours light golden color with white head. Hop, grass, floral and malt flavors and aroma. Medium light body and average carbonation. Grass and floral finish.
This is the way all imperial pils should be done. Tasty, good to look at and with a kick. I could drink this all day...
